I'm an archaeologist. If it's made out of metal (looks like copper alloy but with pretty high iron content) like you say, it's not that old or it should have been way more corroded, especially if you found it in open air. Stylistically the head bears some resemblance to Celtic figures, but I'd say this is superficial and doesn't mean anything.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28029745
>>28029749

Also, a Jesus-figure should have the archetypical side-wound. I do agree the backside looks flattened and that is typical for figures mounted on crosses (or to the wall). Perhaps it's like someone's art academy project or something like that.

You can have the metal tested for composition with XRF, which can then be compared to historical metal compositions to determine the age. This test is not cheap however (couple hundred bucks). If it's hollow-cast and there is a sufficient amount of ceramic core still present inside you can have that TL-tested to receive a quite accurate date of when the clay was fired. This costs less than 200 bucks usually.

Honestly I wouldn't bother and I'd just send an e-mail to some local professor of medieval/post-medieval archaeology. You can also contact various auction houses for an expertise.

>>28029289
What people are implying with this, or what they really mean to say, is that when you love someone, it is your duty to remember and nurture that love and base all other decisions on it and the stability and sanctity of your relationship, your person. People end up either hurting the person they love very much, or in loveless marriages because they get this all fucked up. People with hang-ups or who aren’t ready to settle down don’t like it when that ineffable feeling of connection doesn’t easily translate to doing the dishes without being asked, or asking for the dishes to be done without being a cunt about it. People who did have that special feeling and base their lives around it by being faithful, slaving away for the house and kids, giving up freedom and childhood dreams, etc. sometimes haven’t checked in to see if that feeling is still there on either or both sides. Or if they’re devoting themselves without a real reservoir of that beyond-a-decision love. Or if they are devoting themselves to someone who lost or never had that quality of love for them.
Love is not a decision, but people mean the commitment that is the rightful and logical conclusion/lifetime promise of that love is a decision you have to actively make. Especially when you’re struggling. Especially when the anxious spark of new infatuation has long since spread to an eternal hearth fire, changed color but not dimmed —but the kids’ fucking socks and skateboards and his beer cans and her makeup are strewn all about distracting and desecrating. Sometimes it feels like the love you’ve had and hopefully still do have for that person, and that they’ve had/do have for you, is the only thing making that larger yarn ball decision of culminating decisions a decision still worth making.
Love is easy, building and maintaining a life and family with the person you love is harder than it should be if this were a perfect world with no lessons to learn.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28024075
>I follow these generals to get an idea of what I'm competing against
You don't compete against aything but your past life. Every improvement that you make is a win.

You want friends and hobbies? Not easy when you are out of school and working fulltime, but not impossible. These three steps should get you started. Important is, that you set SMART goals for everyone of them.

Step 1: Try any hobby that is easily available in your area. No matter what. Even if you don't like it, you will have some experience gathered from that. GOALS: Until end of March you will have tried out 3 different hobbies. Two of them you visited at least twice. No excuses.

Step 2: Think of old friends or loose acquaintances that you like. Try hanging out with them. GOALS: Until end of March you will have spoken (person or phone) to 3 old contacts as well as texted 3 different persons. You ask them to do any activity togehter, maybe one of your new hobbies? You can also meet with distant family. Someone not picking up the phone is not an excuse

Step 3: Read a book on social cues "how to win friends and influence people" is often recommended. Finish it until end of March. No Excuses.

After doint this you should be able to stand on your own feet. It won't be easy. In fact there is a good chance, that you will feel like a weirdo outcast for years to come, but it does get easier. I speak from experience.

Hmmmm. It's a bad idea for sure, but if you're gonna do it let me give you some advice:
>Only do it socially.
>Keep nicotine consumption to the weekends.

Greentext is due diligence re: harm minimisation. Again: No, don't do it, but I really doubt an anon telling you not to will do much to dissuade you.

It's not like I'm a fanatic about this stuff, I've actually read enough to know decades of public health propaganda mean you probably think smoking and nicotine are worse for you than they actually are. Did you know that one of the most comprehensive longevity studies on smoking showed no increase in all cause mortality if the individual smoker quits before 30? Did you know the MacArthur foundation study on successful ageing showed fairly authoritatively that starting exercise is better than quitting smoking? I would even argue that nicotine is better, broadly speaking, than alcohol - at least smoking only ever kills the smoker (second hand smoke really is almost totally baseless, I'm sure there's research but there's literally research to confirm any bias you like). But even with alcohol it still warrants some nuance: Alcohol might be a poison (hence why it's bitter) but selective pressures relating to alcohol would've started over 2 million years ago in our simian ancestors (fruit fermenting naturally - we would've evolved to eat a lot of this as we transitioned to eat more plants, and the fact we relied so heavily on rotting, fermented, fruit would've been a selective pressure towards better tolerating roots and meat).

Anyway, this is becoming needlessly baroque. All you really need to know is that if you're not already a smoker and drinker it's probably not a good idea to start.

>>28026304

That's not how that works at all. It's like someone coming to beat you up and you swing back, then a pissant like you says "once violent always violent". Your comment is ignorant as pig shit.

People cheat because there's fundamental problems in the relationship, but due to emotional attachment they don't want to end the relationship. Almost always the cheater has tried to communicate those deficiencies to the other party and it's fallen on deaf ears. Cheating is rarely about sex, it's mostly about fulfilling deficiencies in a relationship.

If someone cheats, it's because both parties in the relationship have done wrong. Statistically relationships that have one party cheat and that event acts as a catalyst for change in both parties, those relationships become stronger and more committed. It all depends on the specifics of what's missing in the relationship, whether it can be fixed, and whether both parties are interested in fixing it.

If you want to avoid being cheated on, it's pretty simple. Meet your partners needs, all of them and all of the needs of the relationship. That's how a healthy relationship functions, just some people need a betrayal to understand that. Others never understand it and go through life wondering why finding someone is so hard. It's not hard. Being in a relationship isn't about you, being in a relationship is about the other person. When both people in the relationship look out for the other party over themselves then you get a loving, safe, healthy relationship where the needs of each is met.

It's literally described in the standard western marriage vows.

posts.com:
I need some voices of reason here. I feel ridiculous but I get incredibly jealous of my 11 year old stepdaughter when she cuddles/hangs on my husband. Here’s some context:

So I came into my stepdaughter's life when she was 7. We get along fine but I remember even at that point having an intense feeling of jealousy one day when I came in and saw her and my husband spooning on the couch, taking a nap together. It should’ve been sweet and cute to me, but it made me feel awful. Most of the time they never cuddle, it’s usually limited to hugs and hand holding and tickling, so when the cuddling happens it feels out of place from what I’m used to seeing between them.

It gets waaay worse when we are around others, almost like they are putting on a “show” of affection for the audience. Recently, my father in law stayed with us over Christmas for a few days and the ENTIRE time it’s like they couldn’t peel off of each other. Every time I turned around she was draped over his lap, hugging onto his arm and constantly (like every 15 minutes at times) saying “Daddy? I love you.”

It should be sweet, I should think it’s cute and be happy they have a sweet relationship. It’s just so off putting to me especially when it doesn’t happen 85 percent of the time. And man, I’m so jealous! I want my husband to give me some of that attention when it’s happening and it legit feels like he’s hugging onto another woman sometimes, despite my brain screaming at me that I’m being a terrible person for feeling that way. And it makes me feel weird when I try to hold his hand or touch him in any way when he’s in that mode with her because I almost feel like I’m intruding on something.

What can I do to get over this? My solution when this happens is to keep it to myself and act like nothing is wrong because I would feel so awful saying a word of this to my husband. It bothers me so much that I can’t just look at them and think it’s cute.

posts.com: 2020 was the same for me brother. I was in a slump. Bad. I had no job, my social life had withered away because I graduated high school the previous year, and was taking all my college courses online, and I wanted a girlfriend bad but had no way to reach one. I was lonelier than ever and my life was empty amd I felt like utter shit about it. I needed connection. You are on track to success. You're already doing good by recognizing your slump. What you need to do now is find some kind of motivation to change the things you think are wrong with your life because the only one who can do that is you. It won't come as a spontaneous burst of energy to get out there and fix shit. It'll come little by little and you need to foster its growth. I'm gonna tell you right now that my advice isn't going to be the greatest out there because I don't know you, or your problems. What I can tell you though is that you have the power to fix them. I know it sounds like generic horseshit but understand that it's coming from someone who's tried it and found success. I found my current girlfriend on /soc/ and we intend to get married. Use what you know to build bridges and cross those bridges to get to a brighter place. If a jobless virgin with withering social connections like I was can take initiative to grow and find love, friends, and some mild form of success then you can too. Don't start with big leaps and bounds because you'll find yourself out of your depth quick. Just pace yourself, and stay motivated. Something good will come your way if you persist. I believe in you.

Being around him makes me sad because it makes me think what could have been if I actually had a father growing up. He feels like a stranger to me.
Also the usual, no friends, no girlfriend. Nobody sent me a merry Christmas or happy new year.
I also miss my best (and only) friend so much. She was the only person I could talk with honesty. I was so stupid, I was so rude to her for no reason at all. I just want to talk to her again, but there's no going back. I wouldn't be here, doing this if I wasn't an idiot to her.
I feel hopeless. In 2019, I attempted suicide but have been getting both psychological and psychiatric treatment since then. In some ways, things got better. I entered college, got a job, found my best friend. I thought I really grew as a person since then, but these last months I feel like I almost completely regressed to the mindset I had back in 2019.
I feel like all this effort was for nothing. No matter what I do, I won't be happy. I will always fuck something up. I feel like I am a broken product that can't be reworked, only discarded.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28027320
The fancy term for this is chronotherapy. It's a useful technique for some people, but carries the risk you might find it harder to stop your sleep/wake times from continuing to process once you come back around the clock.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chronotherapy_(sleep_phase)#Side_effects
https://www.circadiansleepdisorders.org/info/N24chrono.php
https://rarediseases.org/rare-diseases/non-24-hour-sleep-wake-disorder/ (see "iatrogenic")

My advice is to go to bed when you're tired and get up when you feel well-rested, while maintaining your health as best you can (exercise, good food, minimize stress, good sleep hygiene). If after that your body still wants you to go to bed at 5:00, then you might just be a late sleeper. Some people are like that, sorry.

posts.sub: got high for the first time
posts.com:
tl;dr is the way I felt normal?

sounds crazy but im 31, and finally felt high for the first time in my life. I was given an edible at a NYE party last night that had delta 8 in it. I took 1 gummy which I think was way too much, and the best way i could describe the sensation was like how I felt when I got anesthethia for surgery. Everything seemed hazy, voices sounded far away, i felt zoned out, everyone was moving in slow motion. This lasted for a few hours, and even during the down phase, I felt the same way as I did hen I woke up in the recovery room, groggy, dizzy, sleepy. it was like I was in the hospital again.
I didnt take it well, my anxiety kicked in because i didnt expect to feel this way and wanted to go upstairs to a room and be alone, but they were all locked so i ended up sitting outside on the porch in a chair for a few hours, since I has no concept of time. It was like people were talking to me, and I wasnt able to focus on them or myself, id lose my train of thought and just zone out.

my question is, is this a normal feeling from a really strong thc/delta 8 gummy? I was talking about anesthesia and how it makes you feel right before i took it, so I'm wondering if my mind cause me to have that effect.

While it's obviously wrong to force yourself on your spouse, it shouldn't be treated as rape. It would be a legal nightmare to have the same sweeping definition of "sex without explicit and continued consent" for rape even within a marriage, where presumably the partners wanted to be with each other anyway, because it would become an incredibly easy way for someone to make a criminal accusation and completely blow up the marriage.
There should be recourse against abuse by a spouse, and forced sex should generally count as abuse (either as a pattern, or a single incident violent enough to leave physical evidence), but the last thing marriage needs is the ability to make 'rape' accusations at the drop of a hat.

>>28028751
Whether you can prove it in court or not is besides the point. I'm mostly concerned with the consequences to marriages of being *able* to prove 'rape' under such a wide definition.

>>28028767
>why should a man get off on rape charges just cause we are married
Because marriage implicitly consents to sex at some point. Is it automatically sexual assault for a man to gently grab his wife in bed without asking? There is a LOT more grey than the stereotype of a stranger forcing himself on a woman.
I didn't say that a man forcing his wife to have sex was in any way alright. I said that it shouldn't be treated as rape, because that lumps together two very different contexts. This carries the risk of both lessening the severity of "actual" rape or massively overstating the severity of technically non-consensual sex within marriage.
I think we can both agree that a guy forcing himself on his wife who screams for him to stop is totally repugnant. But applying the legal definition of rape can even include a woman who simply doesn't feel like she wants to keep having sex with her husband in the middle of it, and if she only implicitly consented at the start (no verbal affirmative consent), this is still "rape". To put that on exactly the same standing as forcible rape, which should properly be a capital crime, and to encourage people to report on their spouses for that, is corrosively bad.

As I said before, just because I don't think it should be treated exactly like rape doesn't mean I condone it. It should more properly be treated as a kind of spousal abuse. I should also say that if things even get to the point where a court is necessary, regardless of what the charge is called, it's already far too late. The main concern at that point is making sure victims can protect themselves. Otherwise, the priority should be minimizing the number of abusive relationships in the first place so that nobody has to resort to the legal system for help.

It's always exhausting when feminists find evidence for their pet theories even when there's nothing there. I'll say it again: I was comparing two pairs of crimes where the acts were the same but the contexts differed. One pair is the one a few people are getting pissy for absolutely no reason other than reflexive anger that I'm somehow condoning rape. The other is a totally uncontroversial distinction, which is a precedent for my point about rape.

There was no additional meaning from me. I wasn't saying rape IS theft, or even comparing rape to theft beyond the most basic "they're both crimes". My point was explaining the relationships involved, to show that the same act in different contexts can be treated with different legal mechanisms.

Try just thinking about what is said instead of searching for unspoken things to get angry about. Of all the potential takes to get assblasted over, it's bizarre to do it to mine, when I have repeatedly gone out of my way to say that what you or others call marital rape should still be punished. >>28029203
I don't think either of us is interested in an autistic comparative law session when my only reason for bringing that up was to show that the idea of having distinct crimes that differ only by context isn't a completely crazy/untested one. That it's been done anywhere is enough to make the point.

My personal belief is that it's better to be specific, because that more readily allows for differences of focus or procedure. I'm not making an abstract argument that the term "marital rape" is some sort of cosmic aberration that no legal system should ever break reality by using. I'm saying that I think the kind of wrong it refers to is best handled as its own category instead of being subsumed into something similar. I won't shed a single tear if a man who abuses his wife is punished by a rape provision rather than a spousal abuse provision. That they get effectively punished is the goal, and I think having a specific definition of a crime is the better way to that, but if they get punished by generalities, I won't complain about a system that works.

Somehow, some anons seem to have taken that and warped it into the caricature of "what some people call marital rape shouldn't be punished", even though I was very careful from the start to say that wasn't even remotely my position. I know it's a charged topic, but I don't think expecting people to read full posts is a very big ask if they're going to get so incensed.

posts.com:
Do you have any other symptoms? Pain when going, stomach cramps, etc.? Like the other anons said this is bright red blood, meaning fresh, meaning close to the end of your colon.
However, this is *always* something to see a doctor for. I understand you don't have health insurance, and not to be Dr. WebMD but it could as simple as hemorrhoids or as bad as polyps / *potential* colon or rectal cancer. I have crohn's disease and before I was diagnosed one day I had pretty excruciating stomach pain. Shortly thereafter my toilet looked like someone poured red kool-aid into it (that is, it was fucking filled with blood.) That was a real "oh shit" moment for me.
Anyway, there is no way to tell for sure unless you see a doctor and likely have a scope done. If you're in the US and a doctor recommends a scope, look into resources like https://colonoscopyassist.com/ Hospitals will more often than not work with you on a repayment plan as well. It sucks not having insurance but there are a lot of assistance programs available and dealing with people over the phone for hours on end is a hell of a lot better than letting something go from bad but manageable to potentially devastating.
Wishing the best of luck, anon.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: Learn the basics anon. Download percussion samples. Play around with Ableton Live's drum kits. Learn how synthesizers work (ADSR, LFOs, etc). If you don't know much music theory, an easy way to get cool sounds is by using seventh chords. Get accustomed to time signatures too. You're probably working with 4 bars in 4/4. You should know triplets, quarter-notes, eight-notes, sixteenths. Also, layering. Layers also make shit sound cooler. Could be harmony, counterpoint, ambiance, whatever.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: Unironically just practice, relentlessly look things up and stick to it. Only reason I'm any good at production is cause I've been obsessively dabbling in it for years. Start with simpler tracks if you're feeling overwhelmed or getting frustrated and ragequitting. Making music should be fun and flowing first and foremost. Maybe make some groovy loops, then overtime you can expand your melodies, sequence more complex percussion etc. What parts more specifically are you getting frustrated at?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>28026894
Number 6 on Reznor's list pops up a lot regarding creativity. It makes a lot of sense. If you restrict yourself to a few elements, you can succeed pretty well at making permutations of them. It's easier to grasp, and it keeps you from becoming overwhelmed with possibilities. Gradually you will expand and be able to juggle many things at once. Interestingly, you can hear this principle at work in both the simplest and the most complex pieces. Minimalism seeks great deliberation in everything it goes. Maximalism is meant to employ deep soundscapes that breathe unique life into a track.
